description: Gameplay is straightforward, basic graphics could be improved. Wish for more contrast between the tiles and the numbers on the tiles. It is also difficult to determine which port belongs to which resource which could be fixed by more defined icons.
Only improvement I'd make is to give a price list for things somewhere.

I'm a bit annoyed that the game doesn't call it "wood", "wheat", and "sheep" like everyone else I know that plays the game does, and also that you can't trade after you build something, but other than that, it's very good.

I don't know whether not trading after building is in the official rules or not but it's annoying nonetheless

I understand that it is best played with 4+ people but I just wanted to test it.. and was hoping to just get AI players as a tutorial, per say... graphics fell a little poor, but I would advice making a tutorial game, where a person can play against a group of AI's that emulate human play.
Lastly when it comes to playing with other people. consider people who don't want to buy the board game, but instead have either a large table top monitor to play this on or multiple people on a LAN playing between devices? don't force us to talk to your servers to play collectively
summary: I was hoping to start playing straight away

description: Lots of options. Would be great to have more maps and that you don't allow 6 & 8 lands to ever touch each other. And that you don't keep getting the thief when you only have 3 points and every one else is bordering 8 points. That just seems like you are the one they are always going to pick on. It's why the bots are ruthless. You either get the upper hand right away or you die.
summary: Great clone of the real game

description: Graphics and gameplay glitches. The cursor lags and pieces won't move when they should sometimes. And more I don't care to list.
summary: Too many bugs to play reliably

description: Je la recommande. Ca fonctionne tout comme le jeu de plateau. Pas de bug, les fenêtres sont redimensionnables pour gérer vore partie comme bon vous semble. Niveaux personnalisés: renouvellement du jeu assuré!
summary: Bonne version des Colons de Catane

description: Un bon jeu de plateau adapté sur ordinateur avec de nouvelles cartes et entièrement paramétrable. Prenez le temps de lire les règles sur Internet et développez vos cités grâce aux 5 ressources: bois, laine, pierre, blé et argile. Une partie dure environ 30 minutes. Il y a une part de hazard qui n'est pas désagréable.
